Raw material extraction.description: Extraction and processing of raw materials such as metals, rare earth elements, and petroleum for plastic components.
Raw material extraction.rationale: The extraction of raw materials is critical for the creation of electronic components and the glass and metal body.

Battery component production.description: Production of lithium-ion batteries including the extraction and refinement of lithium and other chemicals.
Battery component production.rationale: Batteries are a significant component of the device, especially given its Warp Charge technology.

Transport of raw materials to manufactur.description: Transportation of raw materials from extraction sites to factories for component manufacturing.
Transport of raw materials to manufactur.rationale: Transport logistics impact the energy consumption and emissions of the product lifecycle.

Component manufacturing.description: Manufacturing electronics like processors, displays, and camera systems.
Component manufacturing.rationale: The core functionality of the phone depends on the efficient production of electronic components.

Assembly of Device.description: Final assembly of the device including the integration of all components into the finished product.
Assembly of Device.rationale: Assembly is where all components are brought together to form the operational smartphone.

Distribution to retailers.description: Transporting the finished product to retailers and distribution centers.
Distribution to retailers.rationale: Ensures product availability for consumers and influences the environmental footprint due to transportation.

Retail storage.description: Storage of devices at retail locations before sale.
Retail storage.rationale: Storage conditions can impact energy costs and potential product degradation.

Consumer purchase.description: The process of a consumer purchasing the device.
Consumer purchase.rationale: Completes the product's journey from production to user.

Device operation.description: Use of the smartphone by the consumer, including all functionalities.
Device operation.rationale: Operational energy consumption has a significant impact over the phone's lifecycle.

Software updates.description: Regular updates to the phone's software for optimal performance and security.
Software updates.rationale: Software maintenance doesn't directly involve hardware changes but affects software longevity.

Screen replacement.rationale: A commonly needed repair due to accidental damage.

Battery replacement.description: Professional replacement of the internal battery.
Battery replacement.rationale: As a common wear item, it affects device longevity and user satisfaction.

N/A.rationale: Refurbishment is generally less applicable to individual users as it takes place at company facilities.

Energy consumption.description: Energy used by the smartphone while operational and charging.
Energy consumption.rationale: Operational energy is a significant component of the overall environmental impact of consumer electronics.

N/A.rationale: Smartphones generally do not have direct water consumption in their use or operation.

Device collection.description: Collection of the smartphone for recycling or safe disposal.
Device collection.rationale: Influences the environmental efficiency of the product's end-of-life stage.

Transport to recycling facility.description: Transportation of collected devices to processing or recycling facilities.
Transport to recycling facility.rationale: Critical for managing logistical costs and emissions in the end-of-life phase.

Material recovery.description: Process of extracting usable materials from disposed electronics for reuse.
Material recovery.rationale: Enables the recycling of valuable materials reducing the need for new raw materials.

Waste disposal.description: Final disposal of non-recoverable materials in landfills or other facilities.
Waste disposal.rationale: Necessary to safely manage waste that cannot be reused or recycled.
